utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: H – O – I – V – L. Holiv. Lohiv. Hovil! No. That’s not a word, either.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you seriously stay up staring at this Scrabble board all night instead of going to bed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With these five remaining tiles I have to craft a word scoring nine points and I turn defeat into victory.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my gosh. Did you really beat Dad at Scrabble?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I concede nothing. Except that I need more coffee.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: That is quite an accomplishment, young lady. Nobody beats him. Ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. He’s mentioned that. Repeatedly.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah… how the mighty have fallen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Richard Castle, one word short.” I cannot allow this to be my epitaph.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll concede defeat. Thanks. Because I love you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re letting me win after I already won.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under the condition that we have a rematch tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh wow, now you’re dictating the terms of surrender.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take it or leave it. Please.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So what happened here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, according to our witness, one Logan Moore, was hauling ass on a skateboard with a guy on a motorcycle chasing him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like a scene from an action movie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. I know. Especially when the biker started shooting and Logan crashed through that window right there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything about our victim that’ll explain what happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, just that he’s 21, has a California driver’s license. It’s about all we got at this point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this biker, was our witness able to give a description?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our witness is royally wasted. All he knows is that sometime between 3 and 4 it was Death Race 2000 out here. The evidence backs him up, too. CSU found fresh tire tracks in that dirt over there. They’re making casts as we speak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So either this is the worst case of road rage ever or someone was hell-bent on killing Logan Moore. But why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why was he out skateboarding between 3 and 4AM?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Well, if he needed some fresh air he got some by way of three holes in his back from 9 millimeter hollow points.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: So no eyes on the shooter. There’s no security cam footage in this area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our victim’s from out of town, so he had to have been staying somewhere. Did you find a hotel key or a receipt?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we did find this key hung around his neck. And this scrap of paper in his pocket. It’s a West Village address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and Esposito check that out. Castle and I’ll see what we can find out about our victim. Can you just hang on for one second? Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Lanie, were you able to schedule the fitting for your dress?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Absolutely. And the dress that you picked out for me is gorgeous. It’s the right mix of elegant and saucy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I had to do right by my maid of honor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ve gotta go. I’ll see you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So did we hear right? Are you Beckett’s maid of honor?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, she asked me the other day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you have any idea who Castle’s best man is?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: First, congratulations Lanie. Oh, thank you! Second, I don’t know if he’s picked anyone yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah…

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You … really think it’s one of you? You two.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The reality of it is is that Castle’s friends with famous people, like James Patterson and Stephen King.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, man. You really think Castle wants one of those guys standing beside him when he ties the knot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, maybe you’re right. Castle has spent practically every day in the precinct for the past few years. Why wouldn’t he ask one of us to be his best man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t he pick me to be his best man, is what you mean.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh Javi, I’m the obvious choice. If you can’t see it I can’t explain it to you.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Me and Logan hung out when I lived in LA. I really liked him

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was he staying with you, Holly? Is this a key to your apartment?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: No. I – I don’t know where he was crashing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, did he stop by? Because your address was in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Yeah. He did. But it was weird. Logan called last week, out of the blue. He was flying into town and he asked if he could have a small box shipped here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well if it was small why didn’t he just take it with him on the plane?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: He didn’t want to deal with TSA because he said they always gave him a hard time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was in the box?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: His – his skateboard tools and stuff. At least that’s what he said.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But you didn’t believe him.

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: It’s just that when he came to get it he acted kind of strange. He noticed some tape had come loose on the box and he freaked out. He made me swear I didn’t open it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Holly, do you have any idea what was in that box?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: I don’t know. I – I really don’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know why he flew into town in the first place?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: For the games.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What games?

utterance.speaker: HOLLY
utterance.content: Logan was a pro skateboarder. He was here for the New York Street Sport Festival. Down by Chelsea Piers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so the Street Sports Festival kicked off yesterday. Logan Moore was entered into the street style skateboarding event and favored to win. His star was on the rise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s all the more impressive, given his humble origins. Logan’s bio says he was born in the Bronx, he bounced around foster care after his mother went to prison, then he ran off to California and made his mark as a skater and never looked back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he was killed by a gun-wielding biker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not in the bio, but obviously there’s more to the story.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so CSU ID’ed those tracks at the scene. They were made by Michelin S12. It’s a type of off-road tire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would someone ride an off-road bike on the streets? That would just wear the tires down to nothing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unless it’s the only type of bike the killer had access to. One of the main events at the games is motocross and those are the tires they use. CSU is checking to see if any of those are a match to the track.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So our killer could be connected to the games.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. And I’m laying money it was Manny Castro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who is Manny Castro?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A top pro who had beef with Logan. Six months ago Logan showed him up in an event in Los Angeles and then beat him two more times after that. Tension got super high between the two of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. A reigning champion unable to cope with defeat. That sounds familiar.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but then yesterday things got physical. A fan posted this on YouTube.

utterance.speaker: MANNY CASTRO
utterance.content: Hey. I’m talking to you, Logan. You think you can just walk away from me?

utterance.speaker: LOGAN
utterance.content: Don’t touch me, man!

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: Your skating days are done! You’re done! You hear me, Logan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Manny Castro now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s at the venue. They street style event just ended and Manny won.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa! Nice tail whip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. So you know the lingo? Any extreme sports in your history I’ve yet to hear about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I mean, I think catching killers is pretty extreme. And then there’s marrying you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yes. I admit I am extreme. Extremely handsome.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep. With a high degree of difficulty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s Manny.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: Yeah, no problem. A big heart for you.

utterance.speaker: FAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manny Castro?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. We need to talk to you about Logan Moore.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: The guy’s a loser. What’s there to talk about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about his murder?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: When Logan didn’t show up for the event I – I didn’t know what to think but I sure as hell didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Manny, you repeatedly swore to do just that after he beat you in LA.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And in Austin. And Tampa.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: I talk a lot of trash. The fans go nuts for it. It’s all part of the show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We talked to the front desk at your hotel. They said you left at 10PM last night and you didn’t come back until 5AM.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: I hooked up with a girl. She’ll tell you I was with her all night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sure she will. But that video of you threatening Logan yesterday, that’s going to be a lot harder to explain away.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: No, that’s not what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Because it looks like it is what it looks like.

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: Listen, right before that video was taken I caught Logan ransacking the festival mobile office, all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ransacking, as in trashing?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: It was more like he was looking for something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: I don’t know. And he wouldn’t explain himself, so I got up in his face. That’s what was on the videotape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You report it?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: I was going to tell Tom Fulton, the festival CEO, but he begged me not to. So I kept my mouth shut.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would you do that for him?

utterance.speaker: MANNY
utterance.content: Logan asked me for 24 hours. He swore it was a matter of life and death. I guess he was right.

utterance.speaker: TOM FULTON
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m Detective Beckett. This is my associate Mr. Castle. Uh … we’re looking for Tommy Fulton.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: That’s me. News just broke Logan Moore as killed. I’m sick about it. You here about that or the break in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Both, actually. When was the last time you saw Logan?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Two days ago. He was here doing some practice runs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he have any issues with anyone here? Or trouble with anyone on the circuit?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: No. They guys play to win, but it stays out in the park, you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was taken from here?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Uh … so far the only thing I know missing for sure is my gun. I kept a .45 in my desk. Legally registered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Logan know about the gun?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Wait, you thin Logan broke in here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m assuming that would have been out of character?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Hell yes. He was on his way to becoming the next Tony Hawk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any reason that Logan would have needed a gun?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Look, I know Logan, he had a tough go with things growing up. It wouldn’t be the first time a kid like that fell into a bad crowd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What bad crowd?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: When Logan first came here to register, I remember he gets this weird phone call. He answers, and he says, “You got some nerve asking me to do this after all these years. Stay the hell away out of my life. Don’t ever call me again.” Then he hung up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea who he was talking to?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: No. But he was pretty shook up. If he took my gun and someone killed him maybe there’s a connection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, so Manny Castro’s alibi checks, and I talked to Logan’s competition. None of them remember anything about him hanging out with a bad crowd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if that bad crowed refers to an evil cabal that pays extreme athletes to duel to the death, all for the benefit of depraved millionaires.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean like the movie Rollerball?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It would explain the motorcycle versus skateboard murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or … maybe it had something to do with the Albanian mob.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. According to his phone records, Logan received a dozen calls from a social club in the Bronx. The place is run by Albanians linked to organized crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t the Albanian mob infamous for being crazy violent?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See if you can find out who was calling him from that club.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m on it. Oh, Castle. I – I got something for you. It’s that pen you liked. It’s an heirloom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the occasion?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no occasion. It’s just ‘cause – ‘cause we’re bros. Best bros.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is fantastic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No it’s not. It’s juvenile.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So … … Logan’s financials got us a line on where he was staying. All week he’d been ordering from GrubHub.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean the food service?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. They were delivering meals to a loft in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose loft was it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Some trust fund kid. Likes to party with the athletes. A guy names Ross DeKoning.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Like you could do better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … Ross DeKoning? NYPD.

utterance.speaker: ROSS DEKONING
utterance.content: Wow, I’ve just got to say, you can come party here anytime. In fact, swing by tomorrow for my very special 21st birthday bash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, as tempting as that sounds, we actually just need to ask you a few questions about Logan Moore.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ah, yeah. I was so bummed about what happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand that he had been staying here.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, we used to skate together so when he asked to crash, I was like, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you see him when he left last night?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. I don’t keep tabs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Before he moved to California, did Logan have any connections to the Albanian mob?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ah man, you think the Albanian killed him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What Albanian?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That never even entered my mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ross, what Albanian?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So maybe five, six years ago Logan’s mom dated this dude, Enver. He was into drugs and all kinds of bad stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was there ever any trouble between Logan and Enver?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Major trouble. Logan helped send Enver to prison. And Enver swore he’d get even if it was the last thing he’d do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Enver Kotta. Convictions for armed robbery, assault, and possession.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to the case file, Logan’s mom either had the bad sense to let Enver stash his cocaine at her apartment or she was in on the whole operation. Bottom line is Logan got sick of it. Called the cops. Logan’s mom ended up getting seven years while Enver did five.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me guess. Enver cut a deal? Threw her under the bus.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. And guess what else? Enver just got on parole last month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So when he realized Logan was in town he went looking for payback.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so it looks like Logan definitely had contact with this guy. Turns out Enver was a regular at that social club where the calls came from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s pick him up.

utterance.speaker: ENVER KOTTA
utterance.content: Whatever happened to that kid I didn’t have anything to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You served five years because of Logan. It was no secret that you wanted him to pay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that why you called him? To let him know what you were going to do to him?

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Logan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then where were you last night between 3 and 4AM?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me help you out, Enver. Your credit card pouts you at a diner at 1:15AM where a witness saw you with Logan. That same witness said that when Logan left you followed him out. A few hours later Logan was dead.

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: Okay, I met with him last night. But I didn’t want revenge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then what did you want?

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: Prison changed me. I found the lord. Working my program means making amends for the things that I’ve done wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you expect us to believe you met up with Logan to apologize?

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: He didn’t believe me, either. So I kept calling him and calling him. He phone back yesterday, said he meet me. If I gave him $3,000.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would he want $3 grand?

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: He just said he needed it. And if that was the price to sit down with him, well … I was willing to pay it. So I scraped up the cash. He must have still been afraid of me. He showed up at the diner with a piece. I gave him the money. Said how sorry I was for messing up his life. Told him I’d testify on his mama’s behalf, try to get her released early.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did the two of you do afterwards?

utterance.speaker: ENVER
utterance.content: He just said he had to take care of something before it was too late. Then he took off. And I went home.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle. Oh! I have something for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Recipe for Shepard’s pie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this the one Jenny made that night? That was outstanding.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You remember you asked how she made it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, this is her grandma’s secret family recipe. Because I think of you as family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, Ryan. I’m touched.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Always looking out for you, Castle. Always. Remember that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So the doorman at Ross’s place where Logan was staying says that Logan came back to the building last night at 1:30AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he returned to the building after the diner and that supports Enver’s story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but Logan wasn’t done for the night. He was picking something up. Doorman says he went inside for second and came back out carrying a black duffle bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A duffle bag? Could the doorman tell what was inside?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but he said it was heavy so he offered to hail a cab. Logan refused and jumped on his skateboard and rolled away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There was no duffle bag at the scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe the killer took it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Canvas the area between Ross’s building and our crime scene. If we can figure out where Logan was taking that bag that should lead us to our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll get into it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ready to go home?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I am. I’m actually kind of tired.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not too tired to … you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: D for dyad, which means two people talking, as we are now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well actually, it’s been mostly you talking. Well, bragging, to be specific.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, word score’s a 9, plus the double word score brings it to 18, plus the 5 from the ‘ay’, that’s a total of 23, bringing my score to 312 versus your paltry 175.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, aren’t there more important things than winning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. That’s a notion created to comfort those who lose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I was thinking we could be doing something more interesting with our time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in that case, let’s hurry up and finish this game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, how about I concede?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And steal my moment of triumph? No. It doesn’t count if it’s not official. Now take your turn and feel the bitter sting of defeat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Quixotic?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So that’s a triple word score with the Q and the C, plus a double letter score with the X, and another 50 point bonus for using all my letters. How many points is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I need to be alone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, keep me posted. All right. Thanks, Bill.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey man. I’ve been thinking. You know, Castle likes us both too much to have to make the pick for best man, so we should make the decision for him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … … it’s his wedding. How do you propose we decide for him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well … one of us is going to have to drop out. And by one of us, I mean you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Me? Why should it be me?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because – do you think Richard Castle wants you planning his bachelor party? Come on, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Esposito. See, being a best man is a lot more than just preparing the bachelor party. I’m a family man, I represent high moral standing –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh please.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I photograph better than you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Let me tell you something. You’re going down. And just remember, I gave you an opportunity to bow out gracefully. You hear me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. Hey buddy. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t ask.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, as your close friend now I have to ask.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she beat you at Scrabble again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can we just talk about the case, please?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You bet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So the canvas to narrow down where Logan went with his duffle last night came up empty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But do you remember the key we found on him? Well CSU, they traced it back to a 24 hour gym and it turns out that Logan was there between 3 and 4AM the night he was murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the last place he went before he was killed was a gum.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he didn’t stay long. His membership card was swiped in and was swiped right back out two minutes later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just long enough to drop off a duffle bag.

utterance.speaker: GYM CLERK
utterance.content: Yeah, I totally remember Logan. He was in here every day on the rock wall, practicing his climbing. This is his locker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see him come in two nights ago?

utterance.speaker: GYM CLERK
utterance.content: I wasn’t on duty, but we have security video. I’m sure I can get you a copy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Climbing gear?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And a .45. This must be the one Logan stole from Tommy Fulton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why would he need a gun and climbing ropes that night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Screwdrivers, wrenches …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That would be a glass cutter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And tension tools. For picking locks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … Logan Moore wasn’t just a champion skateboarder. He was a thief.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Logan Moore. Child of a broken home who found solace and salvation on a skateboard. But did he use his skills as an extreme athlete to become a master thief? Did our outlaw skater become an actual outlaw?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he was a thief then what did he steal? We didn’t find anything of value in his locker or on his body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well maybe the killer took it. Maybe that’s why he targeted Logan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So while CSU was processing that gym bag they found this receipt inside from the day he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From an electronics store?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, in Midtown. The owner there said he remembered Logan because he asked for a hi-8 camcorder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hi-8? That’s an outdated format.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It sure is. The one he sold him was ten years old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why would he buy a ten year old camcorder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he wanted to film his crime?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not use a cell phone or a GoPro?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey guys. Come check this out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we ran through security footage of the gym to see if anybody was with Logan when he dropped off the bag or if anyone followed him out.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Here’s what we found. These photo grabs correspond to the exact times Logan’s card was swiped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. That’s not Logan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But we’ve seen him before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, at Ross De Koning’s penthouse party.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he’s wearing a street sports tee under his hoodie so we checked out that website.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: His name is Carter Wexland. He’s one of the competitors so Logan would have known him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to his file he has a record of B and E’s and grand theft. And he’s also a motocross rider.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like our killer.

utterance.speaker: CARTER WEXLAND
utterance.content: So I went to the gym? So what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: At 3:40AM?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: I couldn’t sleep. What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The big deal, Mr. Wexland, is that you used Logan Moore’s ID card when he had just been killed nearby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ain’t hard to figure out where you got it.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Yeah, he loaned it me the day before. So I could work out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was a quick workout, considering you were only there for only two minutes. You went there to drop off this duffle bag. And since Logan was carrying this exact bag earlier that night we know the two of you crossed paths.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wish you could see your face right now. It’s a neon sign flashing “I did it! I did it!”.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They got him on the run.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm. I uh … I thought you could use a little pick me up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s what friends are for, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, hey. How are the wedding plans going? Everything good?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Great.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Great. Well, if there’s anything I can do to help, literally, symbolically, just let me know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The two of you did a job together and you had a falling out, then you decided you didn’t want to share the score.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Dude, I’m telling you, I didn’t kill anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, Carter. You had his bag and his ID on you. You were blocks away from where he was killed and you ride a motocross bike. With your criminal record this is going to be a slam dunk for the DA.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: No, no, no. I’m telling you. The last time I saw Logan that night he was still alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you admit to having seen him.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: He heard about my past and hired me for a job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what was the job?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: A B and E. He told me he’d give me $3 grand to bypass an alarm system and belay in from a rooftop so that he could get into a fifteen floor office.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What office?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was on the roof. He cut in through a window, went in, and then sent up the gear with the bag. That was the last I saw him. The plan was for me to disappear with the gear and then stash it back in the gym.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he had a camcorder with him?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: Yeah. I – I mean, there was one in the bag. But it wasn’t there when he sent it back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did he tell you what he was after?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: No. But when I saw all the trouble we were going to I told Logan I wanted a cut, not just the $3 grand. He got really pissed and said he wasn’t some criminal and this wasn’t about money. It was about making things right for a friend who died. He was really intense. I believed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Logan tell you who this friend was?

utterance.speaker: CARTER
utterance.content: No, he didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shipping his tools ahead, hiring an accomplice, all the while using a skateboard event as a cover. Seems to me the reason Logan came back to New York was to commit this burglary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what was he stealing and how is it related to this dead friend?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I’ll circle back around to the people who knew Logan, see if anybody knows of any break ins. Or a dead friend. Oh, and Castle? Do you want to come with me down to the skate park? I thought maybe we could stop by and get some of those bacon brownies that you love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You had me at bacon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh well, you might want to hold off on that offer. That building that Carter and Logan broke into? It was only a few blocks from where Logan was killed, yet I checked the police blotter. There were no reported break ins that evening. But based on Carter’s description I was able to identify which fifteenth floor window Logan entered through. It belongs to a law office of Brett Zaretsky, esquire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was Logan doing breaking into a law office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You guys should probably go find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Come on, Castle. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Rain check?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have you noticed anything odd about Esposito and Ryan recently?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re being nice to me. Weird nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well they probably just feel sorry for you after the beat down I gave you at Scrabble last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gloat all you want. I will have my revenge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Let’s just find Brett Zaretsky right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: New window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Hi. We’re here about the break in.

utterance.speaker: BRETT ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Well I’m afraid you’ve been misinformed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A thief didn’t break in through your window, Mr. Zaretsky?

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well why is the glass being replaced?

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Oh. Small mishap with a bird.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A bird.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Zaretsky, do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: No, I’m sorry. I’m afraid I don’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you mind if we took a quick look around?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, we might be able to help you assess any other damage this bird might have caused.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Yes, I mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Zaretsky, were you or anyone else here two nights ago?

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Detective, if you want to question me, get a subpoena. If you want to come into these offices, get a warrant. Until then, I’m going to have to ask you to leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, there’s only one reason that lawyer would stonewall us and not report a break in. He’s covering something up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A shady law firm, a mysterious death, a young man righting wrongs. Maybe Logan Moore is like Erin Brockovich but with a skateboard instead of you know, other assets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brains?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Brains.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, can you look into Brett Zaretsky’s law firm? Uh … press releases, court filings, lawsuits. See if there’s anything there that connects him to Logan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. I circled back around to Tommy, Ross, and Holly. If any of Logan’s friends died they don’t know about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well someone must. Where did you say that his mom was, again?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Taconic Correctional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s see if she can shed some light.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, I know what you’re trying to do. Why you’re being so nice to me? Beckett clued me in. And honestly, it’s just making it harder. So just … act normal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man. He really can’t decide between is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but I mean, can you blame him? Poor guy is in a no-win situation. But I may have a solution. Come on.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, let me – let me get this straight. You guys want me to decide who should be Castle’s best man?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s perfect. You’re the maid of honor so you pick. We let Castle know. Everybody wins.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, this is ridiculous. Of course she’s going to pick you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s because there’s no better best man material than this man right here. Right, baby?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javi, do you really think I’d pick you with our history?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well I guess that’s settled.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What’s settled is, you two are idiots. I’m not picking either one of you. You want to know why? Because I’m not the groom. Detectives.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s just mean. Well, we can’t force Castle to choose between us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s gotta be another way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Logan ever talk to you about a friend of his dying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe under unusual circumstances?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because we believe that it might be related to Logan’s murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was Jay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what happened to Jay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Logan ever talk about Jay’s death at the time? Anything out of the ordinary?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jay Dixon, age 12. He died April 27th, 2008. Coroner ruled the death a homicide. It was never solved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: COD was blunt force trauma to the head and his body was found at a construction site.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any leads on who did it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. There were no witnesses, no suspects. All in all it wasn’t much of an investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A 12 year old gets killed and no one cares enough to find his murderer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Logan did. Finding justice for Jay seems to be the very reason why he came to New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why now? Why six years later? And why did Logan think he was running out of time? And what’s the connection to Zaretsky or his law firm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If there is one I haven’t found it. He’s not named in this file and there’s no wrongful death or litigation against the property owners.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, get ahold of Jay’s parents. Let’s see if they’ve been in contact with Logan recently.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, check it out. A search team just found this camcorder down the block from where Logan was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A hi-8 camcorder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. CSU gave it a quick look. No prints, no cassette tape, but check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bullet hole. So Logan must have had this one him when he was shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It looks like someone tried to pry open the cassette slot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. The killer must have wanted whatever was inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know why Logan bought the camera. He didn’t intend to record something. He wanted to play an old cassette tape.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: You think that’s why he broke into the law offices? To get a hi-8 tape?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jay was killed six years ago. If there was evidence of his death it’s possible it could be on a format like this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but we still don’t have it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or do we? Look.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It must have torn when the killer ripped it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … voila.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: So I was able to digitize that tape fragment and recover about six seconds of footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look at the time stamp. April 27th, 2008.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the same date Jay Dixon was killed.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I think I can improve the resolution.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s that a construction site?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This could be footage of Jay Dixon’s murder.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: If you ever tell anyone what happened to Jay you’ll be dead too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Tommy Fulton, CEO of New York Street Sports.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like six years later Tommy made good on that promise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Six years ago Logan witnesses his friend’s murder and then Tommy threatened to kill Logan if he ever told what happened to Jay. After all these years Logan couldn’t live with the guilt and came back to expose the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the question is, what was that tape doing in the law office and how is Zaretsky connected to all of this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think I figured that one out. Who do you suppose does all the contract work for the Street Sports festival?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brett Zaretsky?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And Zaretsky represents Tommy Fulton personally.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: I hope you have a good reason for dragging us down here, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How about murder?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Come on, if this is about Logan I was at a club doing promotions from midnight to 4AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And where were you on April 27th, 2008 when Jay Dixon was killed?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: You tell anyone what happened to Jay you’ll be dead too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When I asked you earlier this morning about Jay Dixon you said you’d never heard of him. And that was a lie.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: That tape proves nothing about Logan or Jay’s deaths.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can place you at the scene of a six year old, unsolved murder. I also have circumstantial evidence that you killed Logan in order to cover it up. Now, how much more do you think a jury is going to need in order to connect those dots?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: I can explain.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Don’t explain anything, Tommy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think you can hide behind attorney/client privilege if you conceal evidence of a child’s murder? I will have you disbarred and then you will stand trial alongside your client.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you’d like to call your lawyer.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Don’t say another word.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Brett, what’s the point? I mean, the whole plan’s screwed anyway.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: Just stop digging our graves.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: I’m not going down for murders that someone else did.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: For god’s sake, shut your mouth, Tommy.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: No. Not this time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you should leave now.

utterance.speaker: ZARETSKY
utterance.content: You can’t kick me out of here. This man’s my client.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: You’re fired.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Either you leave on your own or I’ll have you forcibly removed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tommy, what happened? How did Jay die six years ago?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: I started out making skateboard videos with Jay and Logan. That day I was taping the two of them and my friend DK doing tray flips. Little Jay, he was a natural. But DK couldn’t do it. He was never that good on a board. Jay, he had a mouth on him and he was rubbing it in DK’s face. DK just snapped. He grabbed Jay and … he slammed him against this beam. Over and over. By the time we could pull him off … Jay was gone. And the whole thing was caught on tape. Logan, he wanted to tell someone, but we were all too scared. DK wanted that video. He had the most to lose. So we cut a deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of a deal?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Five million for the tape?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of kid has five million dollars?

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: DK does. With what he’s getting from his family it was a drop in the bucket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why you had to hang on to the tape. That money was in a trust fund. DK wouldn’t have access to it until his 21st birthday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s why Logan had to act right away. You were going to turn over the tape and it was going to get destroyed, along with the truth.

utterance.speaker: FULTON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Cheers guys. Here you go. Happy birthday to me.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey Detective! Stoked to see you. Like my new company logo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s killer. In fact, Ross De Koning, you’re under arrest for the murder of Logan Moore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the murder of Jay Dickson.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tommy Fulton told us everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry to ruin your birthday, DK. But look on the bright side. You’re 21 now. You have control of your trust fund so you’ll have plenty of money to spend on your defense.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I won’t have to, brah. ‘cause you’ve got no proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we will, brah. After we take a look at that motocross bike in your garage and match it to the tire treads at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have officers searching your loft right now. What are the odds they find the 9 millimeter you used to kill Logan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where do you think you’re going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With Tommy’s testimony the DA is confident that he’s going to get Ross De Koning convicted for both murders.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least Logan succeeded in his quest. He found justice for his friend. And to think all of this happened because Ross couldn’t bear being second best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You would deny me a chance at redemption?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well keep on this path and there’s a lot you’ll be denied.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castle, you got a minute?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we need to have a little man chat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are … some reports that I have to file.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we’ve been doing a lot of thinking and well … we know what you’ve been going through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We know how tough it’s been so we decided to make it easy for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. We talked it over and now you don’t have to choose. We’ll both be your best man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Co-best men.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And believe me, we’re going to do it up right for you. Best of both worlds, buddy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … guys, I’m, uh – flattered and honored –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, you should be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But I already decided.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You made the right choice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re talking about me, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think we’re going to have a great time. The ideas that I’ve already come up with are pretty amazing. I know this best restaurant –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: … I am on the VIP list -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys. I asked Alexis to be my best man. Aside from Beckett, she’s the most important person in my life, so I - … you will be my groomsmen though, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, man. I’ll be there. Of course.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. I wouldn’t miss that day for anything. It’s going to be magical.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s your day.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did not see that coming.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t believe I gave him my pen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t believe I shared our family’s secret recipe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I can’t believe we just got beat by a girl.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Let’s never speak of this again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Speak of what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So um … where’s your mom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, she and Alexis went to dinner and midnight sing-along of Grease. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘cause. I’m ready for a rematch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: New game. Poker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to play poker against me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Strip poker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your bet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I’m going to go all in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too. But all I have left to bet with is this shirt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll take that bet. What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who cares?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is so much better than Scrabble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.
